• ITRG provides staffing assistance to organizations of all sizes.  • Focus is on recruiting high potential talent that can impact our client's organization.  • Provide leadership/mentoring to clients on interviewing, onboarding and HR topics.
Phoenix, Arizona and Salt Lake City, Utah

Branch Manager (9/2012 - 5/2013)• Promoting/continuing successful IT consulting firm's growth while maintaining a remarkable culture and professional services business model.  • Responsible for Account Management and Staffing functions.  HR/Staffing Director (4/2005 - 9/2012)• Led in all things HR.• Collaborated with STG's owner and other 2 members of the "Director's Council" on strategic plans to grow the company while maintaining its positive culture.  • Worked with a fantastic group of Recruiting Managers who helped the company grow by hiring exceptional staff to provide IT services to client companies.  • Promoted STG as an "Employer of Choice" and garnered state and national recognition (Utah Best of State, Utah Work/Life, Alfred P. Sloan Award).  Some of the new/revised programs included wellness, benefits, training, and employee communications.

• Perform compensation development and maintenance.  Conduct job and salary evaluations.  Completed the 2005 budget projections and modeled recommendations and alternatives for overall merit increase percentages (company on annual performance evaluation and merit raise), merit matrix to support overall budget allocations, and adjustment in grade structure to reflect market analysis.  Presented compensation plan to the CEO and the Board of Directors.• Administer the performance evaluation system and review/approve salary increase requests.• Employee relations in an unique environment where the company is private but the ultimate owner is a religious institution.• Chaired project team tasked with the development of custom Oracle application to automate complex incentive compensation system.  • Facilitate the recruiting and selection of candidates working closely with hiring managers.  • Ensure legal compliance with regard to HR issues and conduct training, maintain records, audit and make recommendations for continuous improvement.

• Primary contact for developing employee relations strategy, issue resolution, and performance coaching for Business Units.• Initiate and oversee HR projects and programs within Business Units.  Worked closely with team in HR and Training & Development Department.• Collaborate with Branch and Department Managers to develop programs and services in support of the business.• Prepared 2003 and 2004 Affirmative Action Plans.• Coordinated analysis of new Applicant Tracking System and HRIS.• Maintained appropriate balance between the “needs of the business” and “what’s right for the employee” when establishing relationships and strategies within Business Units.• Partner with Vice President of HR to establish HR processes, guidelines, best practices, and policies.• Assisted in embracing change at all levels of the organization.
• Responsible for all staffing functions for an Information Technology consulting firm. Recruiting emphasis on high level project managers, software developers, and database administrators.

summary: I am passionate about all things HR and have integrated my nerdy tech side into that.  My full time gig is running a boutique IT services firm.  Recruiting is the heavy lifting in this endeavor.  Beyond that I like to dabble in various tech adventures, whether that is picking up web development to take a hands on role in creating the company's website or studying gamification to gain knowledge in how to deliver mobile wellness solutions.  Exposure as an employee and vendor to companies of various sizes has given me a rounded background in business and some great HR knowledge:  Employee Relations, Compensation Planning, Performance Management, Recruiting, Process Improvement, and Legal Compliance to name a few.  I like to use that knowledge to make work and work-life better.
name: Thayne Martin
title: CEO, Recruiting and HR Professional
